label: 櫓
本: Edo Culture: Daily Life and Diversions in Urban Japan, 1600-1868 . University of Hawai'i Press . 1997
説明文: Wooden tower, often built over a theater entrance. Dyed cloth with the theater operator's family crest imprinted in white was wrapped around this edifice, which served as a type of advertisement and showed that the operator had an official permit to run a theater.
